benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to account

covered: PUT - Valid Request: Multiple happy paths verify 204 and persistence (with required header, with optional headers, empty array to remove all, large arrays, max field lengths).
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: Attempt to update a non-existent account returns an error with a descriptive message.
Input validation and error handling: Invalid accountId format, missing body, malformed JSON, invalid CustomField schema, duplicate field names → 400.
Authorization: Unauthorized access (missing/invalid auth token) correctly returns 401.
Performance/boundaries: Concurrent requests across multiple accounts maintain consistency; large payload near limit covered, including 413 when exceeded.
Integration/observability: Audit logging and external reporting system integration verified.
Security hardening: SQL injection and XSS payloads are rejected with clear error messaging.
Header handling: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced; optional Reason/Comment supported; unsupported headers ignored.
gaps: PUT - Partial Update semantics: No scenario clarifies whether partial updates are allowed or rejected (e.g., sending a subset of existing fields and asserting whether unspecified fields are preserved vs. replaced).
PUT - Concurrency on the same resource: Missing tests for two concurrent PUTs to the same account (conflict handling, last-write-wins, optimistic locking with ETag/If-Match and expected 409/412).
Content negotiation/response headers: No assertions for Produces/Content-Type per spec (especially with 204), and no test for 415 when Content-Type is missing/incorrect.
Idempotency: Re-sending the same PUT request should yield the same state and status (no duplicate effects); not tested.
Header value edge cases: CreatedBy present but empty/whitespace, oversized, or with invalid characters; Reason/Comment length/character constraints not exercised.
Negative boundary data: Exceeding max field lengths/counts (not just at the limit), null values, and Unicode/locale cases are not covered.
Status code clarity for non-existent account: Spec vs. tests (400 vs. typical 404) not reconciled; add a scenario to confirm expected contract.
recommendations: Add explicit partial-update semantics tests: start with fields A,B; send payload for only A and assert whether B is preserved (allowed) or returns 400 (rejected).
Add same-account concurrency tests: two parallel PUTs with conflicting payloads; verify final state and status codes. If optimistic locking is used, include ETag/If-Match and expect 412 on mismatch.
Add idempotency test: repeat identical PUT; expect 204, unchanged state, and no duplicate audit entries.
Add content-negotiation tests: missing/wrong Content-Type → 415; validate response headers per spec (e.g., Content-Type or explicit absence on 204).
Expand header validation: CreatedBy empty/whitespace, overly long, or invalid characters → 400; Reason/Comment boundary and character-set tests.
Strengthen boundary negatives: field lengths/counts just over the limit, null values, and Unicode payloads; assert precise errors (400/413) and messages.
Assert HTTP 204 has no response body, and reconcile/verify the spec’s Produces: application/json expectation for a 204 response.
Clarify expected status code for non-existent accounts (400 vs 404) with product/API owners and add/adjust scenarios accordingly.
